title: How long can a part of music be copied from another, without being considered to be plagiarized? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you use someone else’s recording in your recording you automatically are plagiarizing no matter how short or unrecognizable it is. That is called a sample. If you use the same or similar melody, unique chords or lyrics in your song that are unique and recognizable from someone else’s song that is plagiarism. That is called an interpolation. These cases can be tricky because there are very few truly unique ideas and it can be very subjective. That said, in either case, there are ways to seek approve when you borrow elements of someone else’s work. Be prepared though to pay for the use and to give away some ownership in your work.

How long can a part of music be copied from another, without being considered to be plagiarized? Just short of when a jury could recognize the original song. Copyright infringement cases that go to court are decided based on when the jury can hear the original song in the plagiarized version. It may only take a few notes to make a case.
